channel.title: Jehovah's Witnesses
channel.description: I while I learned about Jehova's Witnesses and then a few days ago my friend and I were driving somewhere that we go normally. There was a church (or whatever they call it) for Jehova's Witnesses hiding in this little corner right next to the highway. I've driven past this spot probably 100 times and I never noticed! Anyways any info on what these guys believe in and stuff would be appreciated.

item.title: Jehovah's Witnesses
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:43, topic:176043”][quote author=Taios link=topic=236712.msg2017712#msg2017712 date=1201443529]
Tell them your catholic and they wont come back.
[/quote]

Hehe, this actually works. They come to my house every once in a while, and we just tell them the truth, we are catholic and go to church every sunday. They usually rattle off a bible verse and promptly leave.

By the way, Jehovah is actually a mispronunciation of the original hebrew name Yahweh, I always thought that was funny.[/quote]lol that is funny…

Read full topic

Taios:

Tell them your catholic and they wont come back.

Hehe, this actually works. They come to my house every once in a while, and we just tell them the truth, we are catholic and go to church every sunday. They usually rattle off a bible verse and promptly leave.

By the way, Jehovah is actually a mispronunciation of the original hebrew name Yahweh, I always thought that was funny.

item.title: Jehovah's Witnesses
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:31, topic:176043”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=236712.msg2016242#msg2016242 date=1201391971]
Fine in that it dosen’t hurt anyone except for the christian, sure, which I guess OK since people should be allowed to do whatever the hell they want… but:

Also some people are stronger with religion, and it makes them better people.

I have yet to see this.

[/quote]
Well i sort of meant that by being happier it makes them better people.

E.g. Some people feel better that they aren’t going to just die and not exist, like my English teacher whom is old but is a christian, though she probably has nothing left to live for she still comes and teaches at a school and lives her life with the christian morals because it makes her happy to think there is something after death. [Which essentially makes her a stronger person, then say someone who has given up believe there will be something after death… therefore it may lead to depression]

If you get what i mean.[/quote]

my teachers a crazy christian english teacher too…

oh well

the jehovas witnesses are annoying and they copied the christians and put bans on everything…

BTW the most believed fairy tale out there is the theory of evolution. there is soo much evidence against it… theres more evidence against it than there is that george w. bush is the current president…

also for those who think im stupid because they teach evolution in schools and they wouldn’t do that unless it was true… read the book Case for a Creator by Lee Strobel

he was a journalist who believed in evolution and then something happened, and he questioned its validity, and he reasearched it found a lot of evidence for a god (not one in particular, just proof for inteligent design http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelligent_design ) and now he wrote an unbiased book about the proof for god(s). he is not a crazy christian fanatic trying to convert the world. its unbiased and he interviewed people who are at the top of their career field like scientists, and they gave him information for his book. (also unbiased)

READ IT it will change your view on evolution and religeon.

Read full topic

item.title: Jehovah's Witnesses
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:24, topic:176043”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=236712.msg2016231#msg2016231 date=1201391680]
Because I consider religion the disease of society, the opiate of the masses, the cause of the coming apocalypse.
[/quote]
The only disease’s of societys are religions that express there feelings that they want to make other people believe.

What i mean is; Being a christian is fine as long as you are happy being one, and you don’t attempt to force your beliefs on to others.

Also some people are stronger with religion, and it makes them better people.

Just saying that I don’t believe all religions are disease’s of society, yet some, like perhaps Scientology are.[/quote]
They want to make other people believe because christianity is the only true religion, and i learned that in sunday school last week. actually referring to it makes me feel so proud.

Read full topic

item.title: Jehovah's Witnesses
item.dc:creator: @JukuG JukuG
item.description:
@JukuG wrote:

[quote=“error.login, post:18, topic:176043”][quote author=JukuG link=topic=236712.msg2014787#msg2014787 date=1201332418]

And did you give in Don’t they get the hint if you keep rejecting them?

They send their kids up, sometimes they have cookies.
As long as they bring me breakfast I’m fine with it.

lol, that’s not fair, they never bring anything to my house Bastards.
[/quote]
stfu one of my mates is a jehovahs witness and he is just like the same as everyone else.[/quote]

And your point is?

Mopman:

Because I consider religion the disease of society, the opiate of the masses, the cause of the coming apocalypse.

lol, I find it funny that your dumping the cause of the apocalypse on religious fanatics. Reason for that is cause they believe that the reason the apocalypse will happen is because of atheists, lol. A vicious cycle indeed.

[quote=“davidude36, post:24, topic:176043”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=236712.msg2016231#msg2016231 date=1201391680]
Because I consider religion the disease of society, the opiate of the masses, the cause of the coming apocalypse.
[/quote]
The only disease’s of societys are religions that express there feelings that they want to make other people believe.

What i mean is; Being a christian is fine as long as you are happy being one, and you don’t attempt to force your beliefs on to others.

Also some people are stronger with religion, and it makes them better people.

Just saying that I don’t believe all religions are disease’s of society, yet some, like perhaps Scientology are.[/quote]

That is wrong, religion can’t be forced. You can believe in whatever you want, no one can make you believe. Same goes for education, it’s not forced but many people consider it to be due to standards constantly being enforced.

[quote=“Mopman, post:32, topic:176043”][quote author=error.login link=topic=236712.msg2016394#msg2016394 date=1201395518]

He beats the shit out of people for a living.

true but dose he do drugs? drink? smoke?
[/quote]

What difference does that make? I smoke and do drugs, and shock horror do not believe in a deity. Am I therefore a bad person?[/quote]

That goes to personal opinion. People consider drug use at different levels, some believe that smoking is bad, therefore smokers are bad. Some believe that smoking isn’t bad but weed is, so therefore potheads are bad.

Read full topic
